dcterms:creator: Leemon Baird
dcterms:description: A simple Markov chain with 6 states and 2 actions, used to demonstrate that Q-learning with linear function approximation may diverge.
dcterms:title: Baird's Example

dcterms:creator: Alborz Geramifard
Thomas J Walsh
Stefanie Tellex
Girish Chowdhary
Nicholas Roy
Jonathan P How
dcterms:description: A grid environment where the agent starts at position (1, 1) and aims to reach the position (n, n) with rewards for each step and at the destination.
dcterms:title: GridWorld

dcterms:creator: Greg Brockman
Vicki Cheung
Ludwig Pettersson
Jonas Schneider
John Schulman
Jie Tang
Wojciech Zaremba
dcterms:description: A control problem where a cart with a pole is balanced by applying forces, with rewards given for each time step the pole remains upright.
dcterms:title: CartPole

dcterms:creator: Richard S Sutton
Andrew G Barto
dcterms:description: An example illustrating the maximization bias in Q-learning, where the agent learns to avoid suboptimal actions.
dcterms:title: Maximization Bias Example
